meanings.definition: A path or track made by the passage of animals or people.
meanings.sent1: We hiked along the trail in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The trail through the park was lined with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel scampered along the trail, looking for acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the trail of fallen leaves.
meanings.sent5: The trail snaked through the canyon, offering breathtaking views.

meanings.definition: To follow or pursue the track, traces, or footprints of.
meanings.sent1: We decided to trail the deer through the woods.
meanings.sent2: The detective trailed the suspect through the crowded streets.
meanings.sent3: I tried to trail my little brother in a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts would always trail back to that fateful day.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh bread trailed from the bakery, tempting passersby.

meanings.definition: To lag behind; to be behind in competition.
meanings.sent1: Despite his efforts, he would always trail behind in the race.
meanings.sent2: The team knew they couldn't afford to trail in the final quarter.
meanings.sent3: The little turtle would trail behind the rest of the group.
meanings.sent4: Her mind would often trail off during long lectures.
meanings.sent5: The old car would trail smoke as it struggled up the hill.
